I'm suprised this hasn't come up already. Should school-mandated prayer be defended?
Nope. I was hoping someone would bring this up, I am ready to go.
Me too. I hope we don't all agree.
Well, the good side of me actually DOES hope we all agree. The debater side is spoiling for a good fight.

I think that prayers to the almighty should be required in all classrooms in all public schools across the nation. That prayer should begin with these words.
 
Allah is the greatest. There is no God but Allah.

I have gotten some fundy wound up about school prayer several times, agreeing with them about their right to pray as a part of a state mandated ceremony at the beginning of the school day. The usual argument from the fundies is that if anyone objects they can stand in silence (with head bowed) while those who wish may pray. Funny though, when I suggest the prayer, they suddenly don't think it's such a good idea - this is a "christian" nation. They are unwilling to stand in silence but expect others to do so.
 
 Can your spell hypocrisy? I knew you could.

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  School-Mandated Prayer
